body_content.explanation: relating to the treatment of injuries to bones and muscles using pressure and movement:
examples: He could improve posture with osteopathic treatment.

body_content.explanation: In the United States and Canada, osteopathic medicine is a system of medicine that emphasizes the care of the whole person, using the latest scientific treatments and also sometimes treating injuries to bones and muscles using pressure and movement:
examples: Osteopathic medicine takes a holistic approach to the human body, treating it as a unit of interrelated systems working together for good health.
Physicians graduate from either an allopathic or osteopathic medical school.

body_content.explanation: (of a doctor) trained in osteopathic medicine:
examples: Osteopathic doctors (DOs) are different from allopathic doctors (MDs).
Osteopathic physicians are calling on schools to ban carbonated soft drinks.
